column1: Grapefruit—Average retail price per pound or pint and per cup equivalent, 2016

1The USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR) reports that inedible peel, seeds, core, and membrane account for 51 percent of the retail weight, implying a preparation yield of 49 percent, when grapefruit is eaten raw.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; the USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR), Release 26; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
